website_summaries.verdict: Ultra-light, ultra-small portable charger that provides up to 3 phone charges.
pros: Provides 3.5 iPhone charges and 2.5 Galaxy charges
PowerIQ and VoltageBoost technology provides ultra fast recharging
LG battery cells are designed to protect all your devices
Includes mini USB cable and travel bag
cons: Some customers commented that it stopped holding a full charge after a few months

customer_reviews.title: The battery pack would not fully charge. I tried ...
customer_reviews.text: The battery pack would not fully charge. I tried using it and it only gave my phone 1.5 charges, it should have been over 4 charges. I tried to charge it again and it would only charge a quarter of the way after 24 hrs. I got a lemon and returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Melody McCauley

customer_reviews.title: Life expectancy is two months and lacks quality control
customer_reviews.text: This portable charger worked as described for two months and then it stopped working completely. I never over charged it and I used it sparingly. Now, it will not charge-up, turn on or charge any device. It has totally failed. I purchased two others in May and they also failed after a few months. This product appears to have a design flaw and lack quality control because the life expectancy is less than advertised. I rate it 1/2 star.
customer_reviews.author: willyoung29

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty disappointed with the charger. I've had it for less than a month and used it probably a total of 5 times. It no longer holds a full charge. I charged it overnight thinking I needed to charg it for a longer period of time, but that didn't work either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Charger doesn't even charge my phone. Even with all apps closed it drains battery. I tried turning my phone off and charging it and it estimated 5 hours to fully charge it. My phone was at 80%. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Deggelman

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a couple of months... now it has one bar after a full night of charging. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: HappyCustomer

customer_reviews.title: It worked fine the first time to had to recharge it
customer_reviews.text: I ordered and received this item on January 4th 2018, it’s been less than 3 weeks and the charger is already not holding the charge. It worked fine the first time to had to recharge it, but now it doesn’t even charge.
customer_reviews.author: piyawan chantakasem

customer_reviews.title: Great charger
customer_reviews.text: Update: I’ve had this for like two years now. Still works great! I’ve taken it on so many trips. I’ve been able to charge my iPhone, and GoPro batteries all with one charge. This thing has been a great purchase. So far so good. I've used it a couple of times and I've been able to charge my iPhone 6S at least 3 times with one charge. I really like the light that tell you how much power is still left. It's also pretty small so it doesn't take up a lot of space.
customer_reviews.author: Sway

customer_reviews.title: Died after 6 months of light use! Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in June. It stopped working in a January. It was adequte while it worked but suddenly it just stopped working! It has a full charge, three solid blue lights and a fourth blue blinking light when it’s plugged in and charging through a receptical. However when I disconnect it and plug a working USB to lightning cable in it, the battery doesn’t want to turn on! So... as expensive as this is, it stopped working after 6 months beyond the amazon return window. I’d say pass on this item! Edit: Anker has delivered a replacement and I will be updating this review after six months to re-evaluate.
customer_reviews.author: Josh C

customer_reviews.title: It worked great at first he really loved it
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift I purchased for my son. He is 14 and always using his phone. The charger stopped working. It will not charge. It worked great at first he really loved it. I question the quality of the product and will never purchsse from this company again. What a waste.
customer_reviews.author: T Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Initially great but now it's WORTHLESS!
customer_reviews.text: This charger was great initially. I loved how rapidly it charged my phone & I would mention how much I liked the product to family & friends. About four weeks ago I noticed it wasn't charging properly; it was taking to long & sometimes it didn't charge at all. Well now it doesn't charge my phone at all & it won't recharge itself. I am truly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne B.

customer_reviews.title: Will not charge out of the box :(
customer_reviews.text: My experience with this product is staring at it off and on for over 6 hours now watching to see if it will actually take a charge. I am honestly not sure if I am just really unlucky or what. I can say that the power bank I received did not hold a candle to previous power banks that I owned ((simply because they could manage to hold a charge unlike this one.)) I have contacted customer services to see if they will exchange this power bank for another. If that is successful then I will update this review as to weather the replacement is any better or not.
customer_reviews.author: Rayanna

customer_reviews.title: Works only for a few charges. Update a few months later:
customer_reviews.text: After a few charges it no longer holds charge. Update: after posting this review I was contacted by the company and was shipped a new one. The new one seems to be holding well. I will change by rating to a 4 star as they stand behind their product and will replace if necessary without a hassle. (And the new one works as advertised)
customer_reviews.author: RvnS

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for a hurricane and kept it because it is super convenient. I leave it in my bag and use it to charge my son's kindle on road trips, my phone when I forget to plug it in, etc. We can get 4 charges out of it before needing to plug it in. It can sit for months without being used and still holds a charge. I also really like that the same cord charges it and other devices.
customer_reviews.author: wulfs mom

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after just a few months
customer_reviews.text: This battery pack WAS amazing! It was perfect for traveling, I even recommended it to people.... But I only used it occasionally for a few months, and now it won't charge past the 2nd light. I am very disappointed! I definitely expected this to last much longer than a few months.
customer_reviews.author: ~*Steph*~

customer_reviews.title: I love it.  I'll bet you will too.
customer_reviews.text: I don't have any other portable charger to compare to but love the size of it - a tad smaller than a deck of cards. It charges fast. Faster than any of my wall chargers except my samsung special charger. Maybe its not possible but you cant charge and be charged at the same time. It should just pass thru to the target if trying to do both. Great for long hikes or long flights. Update 8/2018 Still going strong. Holds a charge well. The mini-usb port has never "felt" beefy or stong. It still doesn't but everything still works fine. I only use it about once a week. There is a new version available now.
customer_reviews.author: bnb

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a week
customer_reviews.text: This worked the way it was supposed to for a week. When it didn’t charge next time I assumed it was because I needed to charge the unit, so I did. It started charging my phone but stopped at 80%. I recharged the whole unit again but it only charged my phone to 40% next time I tried using it (both times when my phone was at 20%) before it stopped charging. Really disappointed because it was so great for my 3 year old iPhone 6 that needs to be charged multiple times a day. Returning this item. Hopefully it was just a faulty unit because there are so many great reviews.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: defective - doesn't work!
customer_reviews.text: Ugh! Just received my charger, plugged it in and nothing. No light. Nothing to tell me it's charging. I called the company & they responded quickly to tell me I may have received a "defective unit" since it should've came to me at least partially charged and one of the four lights should illuminate. The company is sending me a return label, which could take 3-5 days to credit back to my account. I needed a charger for an upcoming trip, so this was such a waste of time. I would've happily paid for something more expensive, but this one seemed to have many reviews - over 11,000. Now I need to find another charger. Aggravated!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa L.

customer_reviews.title: I bought the charger based on the reviews along with ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the charger based on the reviews along with Amazons choice. Worked for just under 1 year and just stopped working on my recent trip to Spain. I have a no name brand charger with a lower mah and that chargers faster and is just about 4 years old. Will be hesitant to purchase another Anker product. Right in the trash... Update. Immediately after posting my review I was contacted by Anker and was sent a replacement charger. The customer service is perfect and with the content of the emails and messages Anker stands behind their products. Thanks Anker!!
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Does not charge iPhone
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mom for Xmas. She just recently tried charging her iPhone and it will not charge the phone. I’ve tried with different cords and with my phone as well. NO CHARGE. If I wiggle the cord it will signal that it’s charging and then stop. Like I said I’ve tried several different cords that work with connected to any other power source. I DO NOT RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Update: They replaced it!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how long these devices normally last, but was disappointed that this one failed between two and three years after I purchased it. I only used it perhaps half a dozen times, never left it charging or sitting discharged for long periods, or overheated it, or anything stupid like that, but it simply won't take or hold a charge now. Update: Anker contacted me, said the device may have been defective, and offered to replace it, even though it is out of warranty. That is solid customer service! I'm revising my rating because of that...and the device itself is nice, in terms of design and usability.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Siddall

customer_reviews.title: Sounds like it would have been an excellent product though
customer_reviews.text: It says it supports E-phone, Samsung Galaxy and more. I ordered it for my LG 6. They should clarify what "and more" means. I had to return and get one that supports my phone. Sounds like it would have been an excellent product though. In looking at the same item today.....I still do not see where they list exactly what it is compatible with. "And more" is not good enough.
customer_reviews.author: Patti Ball

customer_reviews.title: No longer charges!
customer_reviews.text: After 3 months of having purchased this it no longer charges!! I press the button to see the battery status shows fully charged however it blinks really quickly as if showing an error. Very dissappointed by this item specially because they are not on the inexpensive side. No droppong, banging, or anything else that could have damaged this item occurred, which is the even more dissappointing part.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy This Product!!
customer_reviews.text: Following instructions, I completed initial charging and tested on my phone. Worked fine. After a fw weeks, I attempted to charge my phone again, but the Anker battery had died, so I copleted another charge on the Anker. It does not work...will not charge my phone. When I called customer service, there was no acknowlegement of my menu choices and only a repeating message of menu options. I will NEVER buy another product from this company again!!!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Quit after 2 Month Complete Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: Just quit read any usb cord going out to charge and of course it gives 2 months after bought so can’t return it and pretty much flush decent amount if money down the toilet. And I have spend more money time and money to find a suitable bank because I use it pretty regularly. I bought this because I thought Anker was one of best power brand’s but the best only lady pathetic 2 months.id recommend trying a different “reputable” brand to try
customer_reviews.author: Casey O.

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I used this one time and it was great. It would not charge the second time and when I pulled out the charger from the unit it came loose and part of the connection got stuck inside the unit. Total garbage. Can’t return because it’s past the return window. $32 down the drain UPDATE: after posting this review, Anker reached out to me and offered to replace the unit free of charge despite being past the return window. We’ll see how it works this time but customer service gets 5 stars. They were very helpful and committed to making things right
customer_reviews.author: Robert McKinley jr

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I'm sorry to say I was incredibly disappointed with this product. I purchased 4 of them as Christmas presents for my family and none of them after the 1st use were able to recharge. I used the cord that came with the charger as well as my own cord and they still would not recharge. So I basically wasted my money on a portable chargers but you not hold a charge. I could understand if it was just one of them, but it was in fact all 4 chargers that did not recharge after their 1st use.
customer_reviews.author: A Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: Astounding that this product doesn't include a lightning cable but wants to charge another $10-12 for it. Returned it and got a POWERADD Pliot 4GS Plus 20000mAh battery pack for less money and two cables, one lightning and one mini-usb. What gives, Anker?
customer_reviews.author: Alice Marsupi

customer_reviews.title: Will Work Until the Return Window Closes
customer_reviews.text: The charger worked for a few weeks and charged my phone just fine. The charger would accept a charge, too. But now the charger will not recharge even after I leave it plugged in overnight. I use the recommended 5v/2a charger that is recommended and still it won’t charge over 25% - only the first light will illuminate after hours and hours of charging. Now I’m outside of the return window with no recourse. Such a piece of junk and I warn any buyers to stay away and find a more reliable brand.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Nicolaisen

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money I spent on it...
customer_reviews.text: I've had an anker power bank before and I liked it but it was smaller capacity. Ever since i got this one it takes forever to charge it up like over a day. Charged my phone like any regular charger but it never once "high speed charged" my phone. It has 4 little blink lights that let you know when it's fully charged. Once it gets down to 2 forget it, it charges turtle slow. I've been pretty unhappy with it. The other day it took 2 whole days to recharge it, just so it would only work for 1 charge. Looking to get a new one but now seriously thinking the Anker brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Sacche

customer_reviews.title: Worked great but only lasted 3 months...?
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this product on Aug. 2 received it and it worked great up until yesterday. Before yesterday noticed the 4 blue dots that lite up weren’t lighting up evenly but didn’t think much of it. Went to charge it last nite woke up today morning and it won’t even turn on. Pressed the power button on the side...nothing? Tried to charge my phone...nothing? Even tried charging it again but nothing? It’s just dead. Not sure if I’m the only one experiencing this problem but just wanted to let you know what issues I’ve ran into with this product. 1 star for working while it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best power for the price and smaller than most others
customer_reviews.text: It is small and can charge my phone a few times. I’ve purchased over 25 batteries in the last year or so for myself and family members and this is the best dollar to overall power and longevity out there. I’ve had quite a few other brands die after a month and this little guy gives me power whether I’m at camp, construction site or road trips. I’m buying more right now as stocking stuffers because they are a great piece of mind item. This product alone has made me try out other Anker products
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: No USB-C Charging Port
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because they clearly write all over the listing that it is USB-C. There is no USB-C charging port which means I can't use this. Deceptive advertising at it's finest
customer_reviews.author: mco

customer_reviews.title: it stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I loved this when i first got it and it was very helpful for keeping my phone charged! after about 2 months it started taking longer and longer to charge though, and now it stopped charging all together and doesn’t work. no one ever reached out to me to replace it either so horrible customer service!!!
customer_reviews.author: Autumn D

customer_reviews.title: A must have for me...
customer_reviews.text: Living in a hurricane, tornado area this has been a life saver. This is the second one I’ve had because I loaned the other out, and never got It back. Charges my iPhone 8 Plus and my kindle all with one charge of the battery. I’ll probably get another as a back up just in case. Works perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival - apparently this is a bad product (read other reviews)
customer_reviews.text: I'm a fan of Anker products but this one was DOA. Look at the reviews, many people have problems with this product lately (and Anker has a newer model). But I'm stuck because I initiated the return process with Amazon and accidentally clicked "replace with identical item" and I can't find a way to undo it. I guess I could spend 30 minutes on the phone with customer support. Big disappointment. Especially since this product carries a premium price for the capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Jawol!

customer_reviews.title: Small/convenient
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered this item in the past and it functioned fine. However this one does not re-charge itself when it is connected to power. I would like it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: 179g Of Charging Power
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using the Anker PowerCore 10000 for 3 months now (July 2017). It has performed admirably. The PowerCore weighs 179g (6.3oz) & measures 9cm x 6cmx 2cm (3.5” x 2.3” x 0.75”). There is a small button on the side of the charger that when pressed, lights up 4 LEDs to indicate the level of the charge. It charges up & charges my iPhone as well today as when I first received it. I was able to charge it when I was traveling around Japan w/out any issues as well. Overall I am very happy w/the Anker PowerCore 10000. For the price, it is well worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Spike

customer_reviews.title: Failed after only one time charging
customer_reviews.text: I am currently attempting to process a warranty claim with Anker. I will update this review when it concludes. UPDATE: they were too slow to respond so I have returned the unit to Amazon. No more Anker products for me.
customer_reviews.author: Not A. Rockstar

customer_reviews.title: Would be perfect if it worked
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to receive this item as I travel a lot , it's light weight & small . I charged the device and placed my iPhone charger in the plug and it did NOT work . Really disappointed since I was going on the airplane the next day and was not able to use the charger for my trip.
customer_reviews.author: Gringyao

customer_reviews.title: A.T. Tru-hiker dream
customer_reviews.text: My son is hiking the A.T. and this is his preferred power source. He gets 2 charges on his Delorme InReach and 4 charges of his iPhone 11 Pro from the 20K version. This unit keeps him going for a full 6-7 days on the trail. For the 3-4 day hops he uses the smaller 10K unit. The only negative is that it takes many hours to recharge the Anker. The weight to mAh ratio on the Anker is quite good. That's important for an ultralight backpacker. The recharge time for the battery pack is not an issue because we swap Anker power bricks at resupply points (we have multiple units). Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: DA

customer_reviews.title: stopped working in a month!
customer_reviews.text: A good small portable charger. However, I found it to be incredibly annoying that there is only one part. I’ve only had this charger for a month and the USB port part is already loose and I have to wriggle everything in and I’m unsure if it is dangerous because it is loose. I normally love anker battery chargers and only use anker but feel that this particular product is faulty.
customer_reviews.author: K K

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective solution
customer_reviews.text: I like these for the small footprint, and they do just as advertised. Before I travel I always hook mine up to a charger to make sure they are "topped off," but I'm always presently surprised to find that they are still fully-charged. The only drawbacks - you cannot put them into checked luggage, and they aren't set up to run laptops. If you don't check luggage, the first drawback is a minor inconvenience (unless you are using them as the charger in a carry-on bag with a charging port and you have to gate-check your carry-on - e.g., on a small flight). As for the second drawback, you can pay more for a charger that will run your laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Rip

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: This is the most awful portable charger ever. Me being in healthcare I can't always find a plug-in so I depend on portable chargers for my device. My device said this charger will charge my device in 10 hours and it was only at 25%. Now the device itself is refusing to charge.
customer_reviews.author: Devil

customer_reviews.title: Bad product
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money Mine broke with in 3 months try to get a replacement from the manufacturer they want you to ship that item and then went up to a month before you hear back Follow up after going back and forth they came back with one it was seen I sent it back they sent out the replacement so I will bing up the stars to 2
customer_reviews.author: Towtruck135

customer_reviews.title: Great value, keeps a phone charged all day
customer_reviews.text: We use these to charge our phones while hiking. Mostly we do day hikes using a trail app with GPS on an iPhone. The GPS can really suck down some battery. The Anker is lightweight, quick to charge, and will keep a cell phone charged all day. We have two of them. When camping we charge one with a solar panel, and take the other hiking. Then switch them out the next day. So far very durable. The Anker 10000 is a great value in terms of storage capacity, weight, and price. Pros: Value, capacity Cons: Can get more storage but costs more, might be worth it for longer periods between re-charging
customer_reviews.author: KAC

customer_reviews.title: One year in and it doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this about a year ago to help charge my phone when I was on call in the hospital. A couple months ago my phone was giving me a slow charging alert when plugged into the battery. A couple weeks later and I realized that my phone battery was still draining in my pocket despite slow charging. I tried charging the battery all the way up to no avail. Disappointing because the product performed well up to this point. I purchase Anker thinking the quality would be better, not expecting to need to replace it on a year.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Marin

customer_reviews.title: A life saver for an old phone
customer_reviews.text: My Samsung Galaxy S6 is over 3 years old, it holds a charge with moderate use for 8-10 hours. While preparing to spend a day in New York City where I would need it to help me navigate my way, I knew I needed a backup plan. This external battery was a lifesaver. it kept both my phone and my husbands phone fully charge and still had over half of it's battery power after being used all day. It takes a while to full charge the battery pack, but it is worth it. Will follow up with my review as time goes on, but very happy with my purchase as of now.
customer_reviews.author: RunnerGirlDE

customer_reviews.title: Life expectancy = 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it on April 2018, but didn’t really use it, lately I’ve been using it everyday due to pandemic and overusing of phone for almost two months and it’s not recharging itself fully anymore, only 2 bars out of 4. It has a fast speed of charging my phone, and when it was working fine it would charge about 4 times or so, but now barely even once. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nazeli

customer_reviews.title: Great for personal use!
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a small personal portable charger bank, then this is it. I wasn't looking for a device that could provide charge for multiple things. Just something that could charge my phone while out camping. Using the cord that came with it, it took a little while to charge up fully so make sure to charge it the day before you need it. On a full charge I was able to charge my android phone from almost dead to 90% and my girlfriend's iPhone from almost dead to also almost 90% before it gave out. It is good for two phone charges. If you need more charge power consider the bigger versions of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse S

customer_reviews.title: don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Just received this charger, i charged it fully then went to use it, got a full charge on 2 devices, so went to charge the charger back up again and it would not charge at all with the Ankor cord it came with?!?! I used many different usb outlets, had nothing to do with that issue, so it’s the cord! How can a brand new power bank cord not work to charge back up with its own brand name cord. Definitely sending back!
customer_reviews.author: nj

customer_reviews.title: Pros and cons
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Compact size, good for traveling - User-friendly, easy to use - Sturdy hardware, won't fall apart easily - Charges relatively fast Cons: - Can't charge a device and the battery unit at the same time - Runs out of power too quickly I loved this product until I discovered I could not charge it and use it to charge something else at the same time, as I have been able to do with other charging devices. Very disappointing when it is the main charger you use and you can't use it while it's being re-charged. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: LN

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: 2 of the 3 I purchased no longer hold a charge!!! Put them in the trash were they belong ... the one left is still hold its charge we will see for how long
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Perfect I have 40 of them
customer_reviews.text: I have like 40 of these because I leave them in my friends trailer after too many white claws so I just buy a new one every time. It’s the best. Charges my iPhone 4 with ease and I love how ergonomic it is. Fits perfectly in my cell phone pocket of my zip off pants.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: One use -  then dead dead dead
customer_reviews.text: I fully charged this and used it and it worked. But it wouldn't work ever again with my android phone. My charging cables are fine and work to charge my phone with a wall charger, but this power bank won't do anything at all eventhough it's fully charged. I didn't discover this until on a trip after the first 30 days so it's now just a piece of junk. No wonder they have an arduous return process and then only good for 30 days. They must make a lot of money on nonworking and unreturnable products.
customer_reviews.author: Sim

customer_reviews.title: Slow charge.
customer_reviews.text: It's perfect for traveling and a life saver if you forgot to charge your phone before an event. I took mine in my bag for a concert or if town & that's the ONLY reason my phone didn't die. The only reason I have it for stars is because it charges super slow. It takes about 2.5 to 3 hours to fully charge from %15 to %100. I can charge my phone completely twice and partially ONCE before I have to recharge the device. Charging the device itself takes about 4-5 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Arielle Mansion

customer_reviews.title: Small and powerful.
customer_reviews.text: Small and powerful. Keeps phones charged. I use it when playing pokemon go. Love it. Edit: bought Feb 10, 2017, now Sept 22, 2019, still going strong. Will try to remember to come back when it finally dies.
customer_reviews.author: Chriss

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as an upgrade to a prior model of the 10000. Had the previous model for about 5 years, it survived many drops (metal outer casing). Battery recently started dying quicker. This new model, doesnt seem to be as sturdy the outer casing feels like plastic. And my older model had 10 lights on the power button signifying battery power in 10% increments which made it much easier to know exactly how much power I have left. This model only had 4 blue lights signifying 25% increments. Works well but I can't help but wonder what will happen after the first jarring fall off a counter onto the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl L.

customer_reviews.title: 16 month review
customer_reviews.text: I love this little charger. It is a perfect companion for backpacking or just to slip in your pocket and forget about it. I've used it with my Samsung Note 8 and now my Galaxy 10. To my dismay it stops holding a charge after about 16 months after owning it. I seen Anker has an 18 month warranty on it so I emailed their customer service. Within about 3 correspondences a replacement was sent out at no cost. Excellent customer service and I'm hoping this one lasts a bit longer
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Compact & Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I'm still using this a few years after buying it, and I greatly prefer it to newer 6K versions. The size is very good, it's super easy to operate, the LED indicators are exactly enough, and the finish is just right: not sticky, not slippery, just high-quality matte plastic. I'm sure I will buy more of these over time, but not because it wears out, rather because I want one in the cart, another in the garage, a third buried in the garden, a fourth duct-taped to the underside of the bar... you get the idea.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Frost

customer_reviews.title: Need a better instruction book.
customer_reviews.text: Would have been nice to have had more extensive handbook with the battery. Print TOOOOO small and not written very good. I was able to figure it out with magnifier bet some folks will have a hard time setting up to charge.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: If I could give zero stars I would
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS PRODUCT!! It has NEVER held a charge as they claim - if I'm lucky I can get 1 cell phone full charge out of it. And it takes FOREVER to fully charge the Anker too. It has been charging since 8am, it is now 3:15pm and only 3 of the 4 lights are lit up. I never write reviews but I am so annoyed and don't want anyone else to order this product and waste their money. If it worked I would give a better review. My sister's and my brother's both work. I got the lemon. (I even bought the hard case to protect it, gggrrrrrrrr!)
customer_reviews.author: Essie

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Capacity and charging time are very good. Great alternative to batteries when there's a power outage -- we always have two fully charged as backups and rotate them with two that are used for everyday charging. Only outstanding issue is the life expectancy of each device, i.e. how many charges will each device handle before they die!
customer_reviews.author: Boston

customer_reviews.title: not as good as they once were
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these from a big box store o when they first came out. I dropped it one too many times and it shorted. So I decided to buy another one from amazon because I liked it so much. This one I got from Amazon has never taken a full charge, takes a long time to three-quarters of the way charged, and definitely doesn't last more than one full charge for my phone. The one I had before this one would charge my phone 3 full charges. Needless to say I just kept it because I didn't want to deal with shipping it back. And it still doesn't charge fully.
customer_reviews.author: paul langeslay

customer_reviews.title: Single charge
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product to replace an older charger I have had for many years. The description states that it does three charges however I’m lucky if I get one on my iPhone. And the charge it does provide, drains extremely fast. Pretty disappointed in the product
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t charge the devices as much as it should
customer_reviews.text: This is supposed to fully charge an iPad more than once, but it only charges mine until like 50%. The power bank takes too long to charge itself, that it does not even fully charge overnight. Be careful, do not buy this product. Unfortunately the return window for me already closed but I will never be buying a product again from anger, and it makes me doubt of buying again from amazon since I can’t return it now :s Update: The seller AnkerDirect directly contacted me and the customer service was great. So even though the first battery didn’t work, they made sure I ended up satisfied with their product.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime Alberto

customer_reviews.title: Must Have
customer_reviews.text: My cars cigarette lighter port is broken, so I purchased this to use when I go on road trips so that I can charge my phone! It's amazing, it has enough power to charge my phone to 100% 3-4 times easily! It does make my phone get rather warm while it is charging, but so far that has not caused any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Moriah Leech

customer_reviews.title: Sleek and powerful!
customer_reviews.text: It is useful for an extra day of battery, that's all. Especially useful for a one day hike or something of the sort. It is tiny and sleek and holds 10,000 mAh which is pretty useful. If you're looking for a bigger capacity that would last you a few more days you should look at other options having more than 20,000 mAh. I can charge my Samsung Galaxy S10 twice with this and it just makes it last one extra day.
customer_reviews.author: Ishan

customer_reviews.title: Failed after about a year
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after about a year. It was great while it worked, but failed too quickly. Supposedly it has an 18 month warranty, but cannot find a way to effectively reach the company to get it fixed under the warranty. .Would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Does not work past 2.5 months
customer_reviews.text: The power pack started off great. It took at least a day to charge but I didn’t think much of it. I took it to England and it did great, but now, 2.5 months later the thing won’t charge. It’s been plugged in for 2 days now and the charge won’t hold. There are 4 blue lights that light up when it’s charged and then it shuts off. It won’t go past 1 flashing blue light. I should have listened to the reviews. Too good to be true. It’s a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Lillies

customer_reviews.title: Anker PowerCore 10000
customer_reviews.text: I use this to power my Sony camcorder and it lets me shoot video for hours non-stop. The capacity of my camcorder's internal battery pales in comparison to the monstrous charge this thing can hold. It definitely comes in handy when shooting long events like graduation ceremonies. I also find it useful to power the visor cam in my car for road trips. Of course, it also charges my phone, which is why I originally got it. The charge indicator lights up at the push of a button, so I can easily know when a recharge is necessary. It's about the size of my wallet and doesn't weigh much, making it highly portable and convenient.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Tiangco

customer_reviews.title: Great back up battery
customer_reviews.text: Follow up to review below. After it was posted i was contacted by seller. Turns out the cord was bad. Changed cords and now this battery works perfect again. I love it. Charges fast and very light weight and small for capacity. I've had this for about a month.it worked great at first - fast charge,high capacity.i used it at work when my phone would die halfway thru the day because I'm always on it.but then about a week ago it quit even being able to keep up with the phone usage,so i get zero charging unless the phone is off. I don't know what changed.and it's not my phone because other battery chargers i have still work.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Bad product
customer_reviews.text: I have had a few ANKER products in the past, but this would be the last one. I purchased it for a trip, but only used it a couple of times in the course of a couple of weeks before it went dead on the road. I found myself in a foreign country with a phone with 11% of battery and several hours before my flight. After returning home, I tried a few different charging cables and it melted one cable. Fortunately, my son noticed it and it did not start a fire.
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: Seems to shut self off under light load
customer_reviews.text: Seems to cut off its output power after a while if the load is very light. I am trying to power a 5V LCD display which draws much less current than a phone. I connect and it runs for about 2 mins then shuts off. If I run my LCD display off a 5V bench power supply it works fine so it's unlikely the problem is in the LCD display. So for my application it does not do the job.
customer_reviews.author: J. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Best thing to get- seriously
customer_reviews.text: It appeared so wide from all the pictures and whatnot which concerned me since the slip space in my bag was built for the thinner battery chargers, but in the end the thing was less wide than my small girl palm so it all fits well. Asides from that this battery charges my phone, ipod, and even gamer controls several times before it runs out of power. Only reasonable consequence of that would be having the charger be charged for five hours but honestly, thats less time than for a laptop to go to 100% soo yeah. Highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaly

customer_reviews.title: Love It.
customer_reviews.text: Not having had one of these before that didnt come free in the mail, I was pleasantly surprised by how many cell phone charges I can get out of it. It also doesnt take too long to recharge. I think I got a 3/4 charge from my computer last week after a few hours? My little stick ones I've had took 2 days to charge enough to power a glow stick. I mean, I wouldnt take this out to the woods for 10 days but for regular every day use it's not bad!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great charger. Started to malfunction after a year, but was promptly replaced by the seller.
customer_reviews.text: After a year of use (a few times a month plus extensive use during three one-week vacations), I noticed the charger started to malfunction. I had to plug and unplug the cable many times before I would see the "charging" symbol on the screen. I tried it with other cables and with other family members' phones and I got the same result. It looked like the USB inside the charger was broken. The warranty for the charger is 18 months, so I contacted the seller with my complaints. The seller was very responsive and admitted the charger was faulty based on my description alone. They sent me a replacement promptly. I didn't even have to send my old charger back.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for aging Cell phones
customer_reviews.text: We got this for an aging iPhone that doesn't last more than an hour or two without being plugged in. Now it can go a whole day, if not more with this guy attached. I have many Anker products and this one is no different than any of the rest. Great build quality and they just work. If you need a power bank get an Anker you won't be disapointed, and if you ever are, they have great customer service to fix whatever the issue is.
customer_reviews.author: Dan & Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Received it a week ago, already dead. Quality assurange sucks!
customer_reviews.text: Well, this did not take long at all. Looks like Anker is skipping on build quality and QA. The unit is not charging anymore, just 1 LED flashing. I sent it back. It's good that these carry warranty. Anker, please clean up your act and do better!
customer_reviews.author: pianogod

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: Lasted one month before it stopped charging any of my devices, still shows full charge but when you connect any device to it nothing happens wouldn’t recommend to anyone
customer_reviews.author: SW_FaDro

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE: Short life expectancy
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: As some other buyers noted, this product has relatively short life expectancy. Mine lasted about a year. For the price, I suppose I should just accept that and get a new one...but I wish it lasted longer. When it's working, it works great, but probably I will look for another kind that would last longer. ORIGINAL REVIEW: Works better than expected. It can charge iPhone 3-4 times when the charger is fully charged. It takes several hours to get it fully charged so good to charge it overnight. Charges iPhone fast. Perfect small size for travel. Should have gotten this much earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly Quick, Compact and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: The charger in its case fits in even my small purse and I have had to use it on numerous occasions already. It recharges my phone so much faster than the actual phone charger. I have used it to charge my phone at least 3 times before I had to recharge it Sure has made life easier as it seems that even though my phone is less than a year old it sure doesn't hold a charge very well. I have a Samsung 7 and this unit is even smaller than that.
customer_reviews.author: BarbieG

customer_reviews.title: Not just for charging
customer_reviews.text: The truck I drive for work only has one cigarette lighter outlet that I have to use for a tool battery charger. I use this to keep the GPS running. On a six hour day, it typically only drops one light, two if I go eight or nine hours. I also take it camping to charge my phone and for a light in the tent and keep it charged in the daytime with a 30 watt solar panel. Even when it's been cloudy for a day or two and it's not totally topped off, it's never gone dead on me, even on long trips. Best bang for the buck brick I've ever had!
customer_reviews.author: RagingBuddhist

customer_reviews.title: First Impression
customer_reviews.text: After getting the device properly powered and charged with the correct adapter it did charge up fully which it wasn't doing earlier. I plugged it into my phone just to test how fast it would charge it and it actually did it pretty quickly. I've edited this review because of the change I've experienced in the device. For 20 bucks it's really hard to beat
customer_reviews.author: Devin Kelly

customer_reviews.title: This Anker 10000 battery does not charge after using it for 6 times!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this Anker for fewer than 10 charge cycles, just for phone charging when necessary. Guess what happens after 6 uses. It no longer holds the charge anymore! I thought it was an issue with a USB port on my computer, so tried using USB port on my laptop, but the issue is still there. I tried a brand new microUSB charging cable, and there is no difference. Basically, only 1 of 4 blue lights blinks indefinitely when I attempt to charge it. Considering that I purchased this item for $28, I basically got to use it for 6 times which basically threw away $5 for each full charge cycle. Just wow...
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: none of the documentation confirms that this charger is actually 10,000 amps
customer_reviews.text: Since I have not used this s*** I don't know how well it works. There is no indication on either the battery or the enclosed pamphlet as to the actual amperage of this unit
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Won't charge anymore
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely terrible. Have used this product for about 3 months now and maybe have fully charged it 20+ times. Will not charge or hold a charge anymore. I basically just rented a portable charging station for $10 a month. Super
customer_reviews.author: Lt. Pete Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Pleasant surprise
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased different power banks in the past and through multiple charging and discharging the batteries wear out pretty fast. I don’t know how many charge cycles I’ve put this one through but I wish I knew because it’s been the best I’ve ever owned. A friend suggested an Anker brand because he uses several of their products. Two weeks ago I was going out for the day and got my power bank out to charge it ahead of time and i presses the button to see how much power it had and it was still fully charged. I HIGHLY recommend this power bank!!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Middleton

customer_reviews.title: Will not change BLE devices nor game controllers, no way to disable auto-off
customer_reviews.text: 2020-09-05 This battery will not charge Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) devices nor PS4 game controllers. That is apparently because their current draw is low (~30mA), and the battery turns itself off after 2 minutes. The feature to "disable" auto-off (press power button, then press again for 3 seconds) only extends the timeout to 2 hours. 2 Hours is not sufficient to charge my BLE device or PS4 game controllers. Original Review This battery works great. It fast charges my Moto G4 which is USB-micro-B and a few years old.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey J. Dunn

customer_reviews.title: The BEST portable charger around
customer_reviews.text: After my old portable charger broke and I could not get a replacement due to the company discontinuing them, I decided to purchase this Anker PowerCore charger. It has good reviews, so I figured why not? I was not disappointed!! This charger is amazing. It charges up super fast and holds the charge for a long time. It charges your phone very fast. The only downside is, if you have an iPhone 6, you can only charge the charger with the black cord that it comes with; you cannot charge it with a regular iPhone cable. Other than that, this is great charger and I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Nicole

customer_reviews.title: This is a winner
customer_reviews.text: Very very small. Easy to use. I can charge my iPhone 2 to 3 times easy off this battery or my iPad once which makes it great for long trips or a long day at school. I even used my iPad with this battery plugged in and noticed the charge level on the iPad going up while I was surfing and watching movies. The unit is about the size of a deck of playing cards. It comes with a nice little carry bag. I love it. Bought a bunch of them as gifts for friends and family
customer_reviews.author: GeoMan

customer_reviews.title: Maintains decent voltage under heavy load.
customer_reviews.text: I hooked a Raspberry Pi up to this and despite pulling up to 1.84 amps, the voltage has only dropped to 4.89 volts. This is a relief after trying a different battery pack that would drop to 4.70 volts under the same load and cause the Raspberry Pi to have intermittent issues. In my limited experience it's unrealistic to expect a battery pack to maintain 5v despite its rating but have only experimented with a few. I'll take 4.89v. The size is also similar to that of a Raspberry Pi 4 so that's a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Danimal

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware! Stopped working  after 6 months of minimal use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in late January for a trip. Have only used it a few times sparingly since. It was great while it worked, but about a month ago, it suddenly stopped working! it will not take a full charge (stays at one blue blinking light) and t has a full charge, three solid blue lights and a fourth blue blinking light and does not want to turn on.. Was not able to return as beyond the Amazon time window. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: C. S. Chowdhary

customer_reviews.title: A very nice portable charger for my backpack.
customer_reviews.text: I received this not long ago, probably around almost 2 weeks ago. I charged it once and put it inside my backpack, the backpack has a USB port on the outside of it so I mainly bought this for my backpack. Weeks later I check on the battery that is inside my backpack just to see if it needs recharging or not even though I haven't used it yet the charge in the battery was still full so that's good news to me, it tells me that the battery doesn't lose charge when it's not in used. Great battery! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: DARILL F.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Like to use Runkeeper when I walk or bike to measure mileage and time. My 6s iPhone battery is drained quickly by this. It was very frustrating because by the time I finished my exercise, the phone battery was dead. My daughter in law bought an Anker portable charger, and I was very impressed with its ability to hold a charge and its capacity. Bought a smaller version for myself and I love it. I finish my walk and my phone is fully charged! I usually go out for an hour at a time. I get about five sessions before I have to recharge.Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: M. Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Not what I had expected - very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my Jackery that I had for over 3 years. It’s starting to only charge my phone once before I have to charge it again so I decided to purchase this Anker product. I wish I’d used it more within the first 30 days because I would have noticed that it’s not charging my phone more that 2 - 2 1/2 times per charge and it’s twice the size of my Jackery. It takes a very long time to charge and doesn’t hold anywhere near the amount of juice I had expected. I’m very disappointed and wish I could return it and go back to Jackery.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Cabrera

customer_reviews.title: 5 star customer service
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I didn’t give this product five stars is because we had to exchange it for a replacement. The problem was that it was taking all day to charge, it wouldn’t hold its charge and would only charge one cell phone . BUT... I get it with electronics sometimes that happens but let me tell you about the AMAZING customer service! Worked with Rochelle. She was prompt courteous professional and eager to correct the problem. I will definitely order from this company again based on how well I was treated
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Haines

customer_reviews.title: Solid choice for a compact charger
customer_reviews.text: We have several older Anker chargers, they work well and last for years. This model is at least 10-15% smaller than the past models but holds more charge. It will easily slip it a pants pocket and charge while out and about. Two minor inconveniences, it takes quite some time to recharge and it only has one output for charging.
customer_reviews.author: TechyNerd

customer_reviews.title: Good Value, Coachella Approved
customer_reviews.text: Quick to charge this lightweight and portable battery packs a punch. During our tenting trip at Coachella, this battery kept us from waiting in long charging lines or missing any acts for fear we'd lose our phones. I would recommend this battery highly for any 1-2 day trips. However, by the third day, the charge was completely gone. We used it to fully charge two devices (an iPhone 10 and iPhone 8s) twice each. Regardless, this portable battery has made its way into my camping essentials pack due to its size, durability, performance, and importance. -Will
customer_reviews.author: William Mogtader

customer_reviews.title: Must have for Sanity in Our Digital world !
customer_reviews.text: so this was ordered 72 hours after ny wife took my Anker Power Core 13000 portable charger and her dead Note 9 to her dentist appointment. 3.5 hours later jer phone 📱 is at 85% and climbing. She said when she got home... And asked "Do they make a lighter one.. Andbwith that, cane the case, 2 foot Cables and we are here and ready to go. p.s. wifes new 2018 Honda HR-V never could hold onto a car charger. Dealer issue shortly If that is not proof I do not know what is
customer_reviews.author: EDC Tactical Tech

customer_reviews.title: Great portable battery
customer_reviews.text: Great portable battery. For most smartphone batteries (2000-3000mAh), the Anker PowerCore10000 will give you 3+ full charges. The form factor was a plus. It is small and can easily fit in your jean pockets; it's roughly the size of my wallet. I've had this battery pack for 3 months now and there have been no issues. I've taken it with me on a couple backpacking trips in Colorado, a camping trip in Missouri, and a few other destinations. I've used it primarily to charge my tablet, phone, and mirrorless camera. Overall, Anker has had me sold on the quality of it's products.
customer_reviews.author: Viet

product_meta.title: Anker PowerCore 10000 Portable Charger, One of The Smallest and Lightest 10000mAh Power Bank, Ultra-Compact Battery Pack, High-Speed Charging Technology Phone Charger for iPhone, Samsung and More.
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackPowerCore 10000
The Compact High-Capacity Portable Charger

From ANKER, America's Leading USB Charging Brand
• Faster and safer charging with our advanced technology
• 30 million+ happy users and counting

Astonishing Size
PowerCore 10000 is incredibly small and light for its large capacity. It's smaller than a deck of cards and as light as a baseball, but can charge a phone over three times and most tablets once. 

High-speed-Charging Technology
Anker's exclusive PowerIQ and VoltageBoost technologies combine to ensure the fastest possible charge up to 2.4 amps. Does not support Qualcomm Quick Charge

MultiProtect Safety System
Surge protection, short circuit prevention and more advanced safety features keep you and your devices safe.

Unrivaled Quality
Designed and built using only high-quality chips and hardware. 

Worry-Free Warranty
At Anker, we believe in our products. That's why we back them all with an 18-month warranty and provide friendly, easy-to-reach support.

Notes:
• Use the included Micro-USB cable, your original cable or a third-party certified one (such as MFi); AC adapter not included.
• Please use your original Apple charging cable (not included) to charge Apple products.
• Compatible with most USB-charged devices, including iPhone 8 / X / XS / XS Max / XR (Lightning cable required), Android smartphones and tablets (including the Nexus 7), USB-C MacBooks / iPad (USB A to C cable required).
• Not compatible with the iPod nano, iPod Classic; Not for devices with an input below 50mA (e.g. some Bluetooth headsets and GPS devices).

What's in the Box
• 1 Anker PowerCore 10000 portable charger
• 1 Micro USB cable
• 1 travel pouch
• 1 welcome guide
feature_bullets: The Anker Advantage: Join the 50 million+ powered by our leading technology.
Remarkably Compact: One of the smallest and lightest 10,000mAh portable chargers. Provides almost three-and-a-half iPhone 8 charges or two-and-a-half Galaxy S8 charges.
High-Speed Charging: Anker’s exclusive PowerIQ and VoltageBoost combine to deliver the fastest possible charge for any device. Qualcomm Quick Charge not supported.
Certified Safe: Anker’s MultiProtect safety system ensures complete protection for you and your devices.

What You Get: Anker PowerCore 10000 portable charger, Micro USB cable, travel pouch, welcome guide, our worry-free 18-month warranty and friendly customer service. USB-C and Lightning cable for iPhone / iPad sold separately

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars28,667 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
